newsitem.title: FRANCE: Elf has viable oil, gas find off Brunei.
newsitem.headline: Elf has viable oil, gas find off Brunei.

text.p: Elf Aquitaine has found commercially viable deposits of oil and gas offshore of Brunei, the Brunei industry minister said on Wednesday.
"Elf has found commercially viable deposits of oil and gas," Pehin Haji Abdul Rahman Taib, the Brunei minister of industry and primary resources, told reporters at a news conference.
He said Brunei and Elf were finalising a deal with the Shell group to process the oil and gas deposits.
The deposits, mainly gas, were found in the Maharaja Lela/Jamalul Alam field in Brunei's territorial waters in the South China seas, a Brunei ministry official told Reuters.
"This evening I shall be attending a presentation of the new development by Elf Aquitaine in the oil and gas sector," the industry minister said.
The agreement to develop the field represented "further commitment to invest in Brunei," the minister, who was accompanying the Sultan of Brunei on his first state visit to France, said.
No details of the size of the find were immediately available. An Elf official declined to comment.
The agreement with Shell would be for processing and treatment of liquified and natural gas (LNG) before being shipped for export.
